ActorService ActorService Class

Definition

Namespace:
Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Actors.Runtime
Assembly:
Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Actors.dll

Represents the base class for Microsoft Service Fabric based reliable actors service.

Edit

In this Article

    Implements IStatefulUserServiceReplica, IActorService, IService

Remarks

Derive from this class to implement your own custom actor service if you want to override any service level behavior for your actors.

Explicit Interface Implementations

IActorService.DeleteActorAsync(ActorId, CancellationToken) Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Actors.IActorService.DeleteActorAsync(ActorId, CancellationToken)

Edit

Deletes an Actor from the Actor service.

Task IActorService.DeleteActorAsync(ActorId actorId, CancellationToken cancellationToken)Function Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Actors.IActorService.DeleteActorAsync(actorId As ActorId, cancellationToken As CancellationToken) As Task Implements IActorService.DeleteActorAsync
Parameters
actorId
ActorId ActorId

ActorId of the actor to be deleted.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

Propagates notification that operations should be canceled.

Returns
Task Task

A task that represents the asynchronous operation of call to server.

Remarks

An active actor, will be deactivated and its state will also be deleted from state provider.

An in-active actor's state will be deleted from state provider.

If this method is called for a non-existent actor id in the system, it will be a no-op.

IActorService.GetActorsAsync(ContinuationToken, CancellationToken) Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Actors.IActorService.GetActorsAsync(ContinuationToken, CancellationToken)

A continuation token to start querying the results from. A null value of continuation token means start returning values form the beginning.
